ai.prompt:
Your Task

Read the human suggestion from the "Human Suggestions" custom field
Analyze the current task's custom fields to understand what's available
Match the fields mentioned by the human to actual custom field names and IDs from this task
Format clear, structured commands
Write your plan to the "AI PLANNED ACTIONS" field

Command Format
For each field to update, create a command like:
Set the custom field [EXACT_FIELD_NAME] with the custom field id of [FIELD_ID] to this value: [VALUE]
How to Find Field Information

Look at the task's custom_fields array
Match human-mentioned fields using:

Exact name matches (case-insensitive)
Partial name matches (e.g., "money" → "Money Test")
Common variations (e.g., "email" → "Email_Custom_Field")

Extract the exact id and name from the matched field
Note the field type to ensure proper value formatting

Example Process
If human says: "change the money field to 125"

Find field with "money" in name → finds "Money Test"
Get its ID → "37057111-4d69-468d-a3fb-23149cc0a1dc"
Note its type → "currency"
Output: Set the custom field Money Test with the custom field id of 37057111-4d69-468d-a3fb-23149cc0a1dc to this value: 125

Important Rules

Always use the EXACT field name and ID from the task data
If multiple fields match, ask for clarification
If no fields match, list available fields
Include field type hints when relevant (e.g., "date field expects timestamp")
Handle variations in human language (set/change/update, field/property/attribute)

Output Structure
Write multiple commands if multiple fields need updating:
Set the custom field [NAME1] with the custom field id of [ID1] to this value: [VALUE1]
Set the custom field [NAME2] with the custom field id of [ID2] to this value: [VALUE2]

ai.prompt:
ClickUp AI Action Refinement Prompt
You are processing human-proposed actions for this task. Your job is to enhance these actions with ClickUp-specific details where possible, while ensuring EVERY action is preserved and passed through.
Your Task:
Transform the human-proposed actions into AI-proposed actions by:

Adding ClickUp IDs and specific details where you recognize them
Keeping ALL actions intact - never remove or skip any action
Maintaining human readability

SPECIAL ATTENTION TO CUSTOM FIELDS:
Do fuzzy name matching on custom field names! Do not say custom field ids are not included, they are...
When you see any action about updating, changing, or setting a field that isn't a standard ClickUp field (status, priority, assignee), it's likely a CUSTOM FIELD. You MUST add the custom field ID.ClickUp AI Action Refinement Prompt
You are processing human-proposed actions for this task. Your job is to enhance these actions with ClickUp-specific details where possible, while ensuring EVERY action is preserved and passed through.
Your Task:
Transform the human-proposed actions into AI-proposed actions by:

Adding ClickUp IDs and specific details where you recognize them
Keeping ALL actions intact - never remove or skip any action
Maintaining human readability

SPECIAL ATTENTION TO CUSTOM FIELDS:
When you see any action about updating, changing, or setting a field that isn't a standard ClickUp field (status, priority, assignee), it's likely a CUSTOM FIELD. You MUST add the custom field ID.
Examples of custom fields that need IDs:

Budget, Cost, Revenue, Price
Phase, Stage, Category, Type
Client, Vendor, Contact
Any project-specific fields
Any fields unique to this workspace

Enhancement Examples:
Human proposed: "Assign this to Sarah"
AI proposed: "Assign to Sarah (user_id: 12345)"
Human proposed: "Update budget to $5000"
AI proposed: "Update 'Budget' custom field (field_id: cf_abc123) to $5000"
Human proposed: "Change project phase to design"
AI proposed: "Change 'Project Phase' custom field (field_id: cf_xyz789) to design"
Human proposed: "Set vendor to ABC Corp"
AI proposed: "Set 'Vendor' custom field (field_id: cf_def456) to ABC Corp"
Human proposed: "Text the vendor about delays"
AI proposed: "Text the vendor about delays" (external action - unchanged)
What to Enhance:

Custom fields → ALWAYS add field name and ID
User names → Add user IDs
List/folder names → Add list IDs
Tag names → Add tag IDs
Status names → Add status IDs
Priority levels → Add priority numbers

Critical Rules:

If you process 5 human-proposed actions, you must output 5 AI-proposed actions
When a field is mentioned that isn't status/priority/assignee, treat it as a custom field
Never drop, combine, or omit actions
When in doubt, pass it through unchanged

Format:
List each action clearly. Include your enhancements in parentheses.

Convert these actions, do not omit any actions: {{task.fields.31702976-3398-4443-9ff0-8ebc5c3db519}}

Given information about a task, your role is to:

Summarize the task to get the most important details and latest updates.
Use up to 4 lines
Use very simple wording and language and avoid fluffy language
Don't reference "the task" just use short-hand to outline key details
Always mention users using their names (e.g. John Doe). Never mention them just by their id.

Analyze the guest message to determine task timing. Output ONLY one of these four values: pre-stay, on-stay, post-stay, unknown

CLASSIFICATION RULES:

PRE-STAY indicators:
- Future tense verbs ("will arrive", "planning to", "when we check in")
- Mentions of upcoming reservation/booking
- Requests about room preferences, early check-in, transportation
- Questions about amenities/policies before arrival

ON-STAY indicators:
- Present tense urgency ("the AC isn't working", "we need towels")
- Words like "now", "currently", "today", "room 203"
- Maintenance/housekeeping/service requests
- Complaints needing immediate resolution

POST-STAY indicators:
- Past tense verbs ("was", "had", "stayed")
- References to checkout, departure, "last week/night"
- Feedback/reviews about completed stay
- Billing disputes, lost items, thank you messages

CRITICAL: Only use "unknown" if:
1. Message has NO temporal indicators AND
2. Issue type doesn't suggest timing (e.g., "rooms are nice" vs "room is nice") AND
3. You've checked for ALL indirect clues AND
4. The ambiguity is genuine, not due to insufficient analysis

Before selecting "unknown", you MUST identify what specific information is missing that prevents classification.

Task Name:{{task.name}}
Task Description: {{task.text_content}}
Message Content From Guest (when available):{{task.fields.3e5cc654-e7be-4db0-ac80-eef5ce96f09b}}

ai.prompt:
Guest Severity Score (0-5)
Analyze this task and assign a Guest Severity score based on how directly and immediately it affects guest experience and satisfaction. Consider booking issues, property problems impacting stays, and communication needs.
Scoring Criteria:
5 - Critical (Immediate Action Required)

Active guest currently experiencing major issues during their stay
Complete booking failures preventing check-in
Safety/security concerns affecting occupied properties
Missing essential amenities (no hot water, heating/AC failure, lockout)
Urgent guest communications requiring same-day response

4 - High (Within 24 Hours)

Issues affecting guests checking in within 48 hours
Property problems that significantly degrade stay quality
Booking modifications for current/upcoming reservations
Guest complaints requiring prompt resolution
Missing or broken important amenities

3 - Moderate (Within 48-72 Hours)

Pre-arrival guest questions or concerns
Minor property maintenance affecting comfort
Booking inquiries for future dates
Guest review responses needed
Setup tasks for arrivals 3-7 days out

2 - Low (Within Week)

Routine pre-arrival preparations
Minor cosmetic property issues
Guest guide updates
Future booking optimizations
Standard maintenance not affecting current stays

1 - Minimal (Scheduled)

Long-term property improvements
Listing optimization tasks
General communication templates
Seasonal preparation tasks

0 - No Guest Impact

Internal processes only
Backend system updates
Team/vendor coordination with no guest touchpoint

Select the dropdown option that matches this analysis

Operations should be maintenance items, field operations, things requiring that we go to a property

Administration is things required admin, tech, handling reviews, etc.

The comments are structured as copies of the SMS, Emails, and Phone Call Transcripts that our company has had with the lead. Read through all the comments to determine what pending items we owe them. The Leads name is:{{task.name}}, their phone number is: {{task.fields.5d439128-7b96-477d-b151-881ffbb20a45}}, their email address is: {{task.fields.292adb6d-7d42-401a-adf8-47ca5652b5ba}}

Explain your decision by providing:

What the guest specifically wrote or requested in their Post-Booking Survey (found in Task Description)
How the messaging team did or did not address this in their conversation (found in Message Content)
Why this qualifies as a "Yes" or "No" response

Be specific and quote relevant parts when possible.
Do not consider response made by the guest messaging team prior the submission of Post-Booking Survey. The response of the guest messaging team should be in a form of reaching out to the guest to discuss what they mentioned in the Post-booking survey.
-If we did not send a message acknowledging the survey, please consider that as a “No” response.

Explain your decision by providing:

What the guest specifically wrote or requested in their Pre-Booking Survey (found in Task Description)
How the messaging team did or did not address this in their conversation (found in Message Content)
Why this qualifies as a "Yes" or "No" response

Be specific and quote relevant parts when possible.

- If the guest request for something and we reiterate or acknowledge that message consider that as a "Yes" response.
- If the guest is asking or clarifying something and we did not answer the question consider that as a "No" response.
-If we did not send a message acknowledging the survey, please consider that as a “No” response.
-If the guest has no request or question and our response confirms that (e.g., "I saw that you didn’t have any special requests at the moment, that’s totally fine." ) please consider that as a “Yes” response.
- If we Thank the guest for accomplishing the survey and we reiterate their response (e.g. "I saw that you didn’t have any special requests at the moment, that’s totally fine." ) please consider that as a “Yes” response.

Revenue Potential Grading Prompt:
Analyze this task and assign a Revenue Potential score from 0-5 based on the financial impact of completing or delaying it. Consider:

Direct Revenue Impact: How much revenue is at risk if this task is delayed?
Cost Implications: What costs could be incurred or saved?
Cash Flow Effects: Does this impact immediate cash flow or payment timing?
Booking/Guest Revenue: Does this affect current or future bookings?

Scoring Guidelines:
5 - Critical Revenue Impact ($5,000+)

Blocks client invoicing or major payments
Risks losing high-value bookings or guests
Immediate cash flow crisis if delayed
Major vendor/co-host payment affecting operations

4 - High Revenue Impact ($1,000-$5,000)

Affects multiple bookings or recurring revenue
Delays significant invoice processing
Important vendor relationships at risk
Co-host payouts that could pause operations

3 - Moderate Revenue Impact ($500-$1,000)

Single booking at risk
Minor payment delays
Efficiency losses costing money
Preventable expenses if acted on quickly

2 - Low Revenue Impact ($100-$500)

Small financial optimization opportunity
Minor cost savings possible
Indirect revenue effects

1 - Minimal Revenue Impact (<$100)

Very small financial benefit
Long-term minor savings

0 - No Revenue Impact

No identifiable financial effect

ai.prompt:
You are creating a professional task summary for a homeowner client of an Airbnb management company. 

Analyze all available task information (description, subtasks, comments, custom fields, status) and create a client-friendly summary that:

1. Clearly explains the current situation and any recent progress
2. Uses simple, non-technical language 
3. Focuses on what matters to the homeowner (timeline, outcomes, their property's status)
4. Maintains a professional, solution-oriented tone
5. Builds confidence in our management while being transparent

Structure your response as 2-3 concise paragraphs covering:
- Current status and recent accomplishments
- What we're actively working on
- Next steps and expected timeline

Important: Frame any challenges as "areas we're actively managing" with clear action plans. Avoid internal jargon, employee concerns, or system limitations. End with a forward-looking statement about next steps or outcomes.

This summary will be the homeowner's primary update about this aspect of their property management.

Safety Issues Grading Prompt (0-5 Scale)
Analyze this task and assign a safety score from 0-5 based on potential risks to guest safety, property security, or regulatory compliance. Consider immediate physical dangers, security vulnerabilities, and legal/compliance risks.
Scoring Guidelines:
5 - Critical Safety Risk

Immediate danger to guest health/safety (gas leaks, electrical hazards, structural damage)
Active security breach or vulnerability (broken locks, compromised entry systems)
Regulatory violations that could result in immediate shutdown or legal action
Emergency situations requiring same-day resolution

4 - High Safety Risk

Safety hazards that could cause injury within 24-48 hours
Security issues affecting guest safety (malfunctioning alarms, outdoor lighting failures)
Compliance issues with pending deadlines or active inspector concerns
Health code violations affecting guest stays

3 - Moderate Safety Risk

Potential safety issues that need addressing within a week
Minor security concerns (worn locks, needed safety equipment updates)
Regulatory items requiring attention before next inspection
Preventive maintenance for safety-critical systems

2 - Low Safety Risk

Long-term safety improvements or upgrades
Documentation/certification updates with distant deadlines
Minor code updates or recommendations
General security enhancements

1 - Minimal Safety Risk

Safety-adjacent tasks with indirect impact
Record-keeping or administrative safety tasks
Optional safety improvements
Training or policy updates

0 - No Safety Risk

Task has no safety, security, or compliance implications

Key Questions to Consider:

Could delaying this task result in physical harm to guests?
Does this involve property security or access control?
Are there regulatory/legal compliance deadlines?
What is the severity of potential consequences if unaddressed?

Select the dropdown option that corresponds with this analysis

Explain your decision by providing:

-Did we submit a Resolution to negotiate the planned rating of the guest?

ai.prompt:
Analyze the task title and description to estimate the coordination time required for a property management team to complete this task. This is the time for coordinating work (scheduling vendors, communicating with guests, updating systems), NOT the time vendors spend doing physical work.
Select exactly one value from these options based on the coordination complexity:

5 minutes: Simple updates, quick messages, status changes, basic confirmations
10 minutes: Standard guest responses, simple vendor scheduling, routine check-ins
15 minutes: Multi-step coordination, detailed guest issues, vendor follow-ups
30 minutes: Complex scheduling, multiple vendor coordination, detailed problem-solving
45 minutes: Multi-property issues, extensive guest situations, complicated vendor arrangements
1 hour: Major incidents, multiple stakeholder coordination, complex operational changes
1.5 hours: Rare complex projects like creating new property listings, major emergency response

Default to shorter durations. Most property management coordination tasks take 5-15 minutes. Only select longer durations (30+ minutes) when the task explicitly involves multiple parties, complex problem-solving, or extensive documentation. Tasks requiring 1+ hour are exceptional.

AI Custom Field Prompt: Time Sensitivity with Business Impact Score
Analyze this task and assign a score from 0-5 based on its time sensitivity combined with the business impact of delay. Consider both the urgency of the deadline AND the operational/financial consequences if missed.
Scoring Criteria:
5 - Critical (Complete within 24 hours)

Hard deadline TODAY or TOMORROW with severe operational consequences
Examples: Co-host payouts due Wednesday (messaging gets paused if missed), same-day guest check-in issues, critical vendor payments blocking other operations
Impact: Service disruptions, blocked workflows, immediate revenue loss

4 - Urgent (Complete within 2-3 days)

Deadline within 72 hours with significant business impact
Examples: Accounting corrections blocking client invoices, time-sensitive guest communications, regulatory filings
Impact: Cash flow delays, guest dissatisfaction, compliance risks

3 - Important (Complete within 1 week)

Deadline within 7 days with moderate business impact
Examples: Monthly reporting deadlines, vendor payment terms, non-urgent maintenance scheduling
Impact: Relationship strain, minor delays in operations, potential late fees

2 - Scheduled (Complete within 2 weeks)

Deadline within 14 days with limited immediate impact
Examples: Routine administrative tasks, future booking preparations, standard maintenance
Impact: Minor inefficiencies if delayed, no immediate consequences

1 - Flexible (Complete within 1 month)

Soft deadline with minimal business impact
Examples: Long-term planning tasks, optional improvements, documentation updates
Impact: No operational consequences, nice-to-have items

0 - No Deadline

No specific timeline or business impact
Examples: Wishlist items, future considerations, archival tasks
Impact: No consequences for delay

Key Questions to Consider:

Is there a specific deadline mentioned? When?
What operations or workflows depend on this task?
Will delay cause cascading effects on other tasks/people?
Is revenue, guest service, or compliance at risk?
Are other team members or vendors waiting on completion?

Select the dropdown option that matches this analysis

Look at the "Summary" custom field then set the following drop-down options based on what needs to be done:

->Decision-based block (Christian)- set this if we are waiting for Christian's decision or action--this does not apply if we have not communicated yet to Christian what we need from him
->Decision-based block (Homeowner) - set this if we are waiting for an action or decision needed from Homeowner or Owner--this does not apply if we have not communicated yet to the Homeowner or Owner what we need from them--or if it was not explicitly mentioned that Homeowner or Owner approval is needed
->Vendor-based block - set this if we are looking or waiting for Vendors / Maintenance Support to repair or fix the maintenance issues on the property,  or if we are still waiting or requesting repair or maintenance quotations

->These are not Vendors or Maintenance support or Homeowners or Owners--Do not set the "Vendor-based block" or "Decision-based block (Homeowner) if the what needs to be done is to be performed by the following:
-Angel Leano

ai.prompt:
Analyze the most recent comments on this task to determine if material work progress has been made. Focus only on human-generated comments (ignore comments marked as AI-generated or bot comments).

DROPDOWN OPTIONS:

Material Change Made
No Material Change
Stuck

CLASSIFICATION RULES:

Select "Material Change Made" when comments indicate:

Concrete actions completed (calls made, documents created, meetings held, code deployed)
Deliverables produced or shared (reports, designs, analysis, presentations)
Decisions finalized or approvals obtained
Problems resolved or solutions implemented
Specific progress milestones reached
External stakeholder interactions completed (vendor calls, client meetings, partner communications)
Data collected, analyzed, or processed
Systems configured, tested, or updated

Select "No Material Change" when comments only contain:

Planning discussions without execution ("we should...", "we need to...", "let's consider...")
Status inquiries or questions
Acknowledgments or simple responses ("ok", "sounds good", "thanks")
Scheduling attempts without confirmation
Restatements of existing information
Requests for updates or information
Theoretical discussions without action
Comments about potential future work

Select "Stuck" when:

No human comments exist in the last 2 days
Only AI/bot-generated comments are present in the last 2 days
Last meaningful comment is older than 2 days
Task shows no activity or progress indicators for 2+ days

ANALYSIS APPROACH:

First, filter out any AI-generated or automated comments
Check the timestamp of the most recent human comment
If no human comments in 2+ days, mark as "Stuck"
Otherwise, review the last 3-5 human comments for content
Look for past-tense language indicating completed work
Verify specific details (names, dates, outcomes) are mentioned
Distinguish between intention and completion

EXAMPLES:

Material Change Made:

"Completed call with vendor ABC Corp - they confirmed pricing at $5,000"
"Uploaded the Q3 report to the shared drive"
"Fixed the login bug and deployed to staging"
"Met with Sarah, got approval to proceed"

No Material Change:

"We need to contact the vendor about this"
"This should be our priority"
"Any updates on this?"
"Planning to work on this tomorrow"

Stuck:

No comments for 2+ days
Only automated reminders or AI suggestions in recent history
Last human interaction was over a week ago

Focus on evidence of completed work rather than intentions or discussions about work. A task is "Stuck" when it lacks recent human engagement, regardless of its importance.

"Guest (Feb 6, 2025, 6:51 PM):
Skylar reacted ❤️ to Christian’s message "Hi Skylar, good morning! Thank you for completing the necessary forms and paying the damage fee through Truvi. As the primary guest who made the booking, you're the only one who needs to fill out those details. The other members of your group are all set! I have your completed guest verification and damage protection on file now. You'll receive check-in instructions and access details 24 hours before your arrival. Please let me know if there's anything else I can assist with as you prepare for your trip. We look forward to hosting you and your friends soon!"

---

We hope you enjoy your stay and please feel free to reach out if you have any questions! Sincerely, Katie and the Olympus Estates Team ***

---

Host (Aug 28, 2025, 8:24 AM):
Hi Skylar, good evening! We're so excited to host you! I wanted to give you a quick heads up that an ECH Appliance tech is scheduled for tomorrow from 11 AM to 2 PM to fix the oven. This visit will happen before your check-in time, but I wanted to let you know just in case the repair takes a bit longer than expected. We're committed to making sure everything is in working order for your stay, so if you have any questions or need anything else, just let me know! Looking forward to welcoming you soon!

---

Guest (Aug 28, 2025, 8:29 AM):
Okay, thank you so much !

---

Host (Aug 28, 2025, 3:18 PM):
You're very welcome, Skylar!

---

Host (Aug 28, 2025, 8:53 PM):
Good afternoon, Skylar! I just wanted to check in to see if the maintenance team was able to visit the property. Please let me know if you have any questions or concerns. Thank you.

---

Guest (Aug 28, 2025, 8:54 PM):
Are we allowed to check-in now?

---

Host (Aug 28, 2025, 9:11 PM):
Sorry for the confusion, Skylar! The standard check in time is still at 3:00 PM. That was only a heads up in case the crew is still there. Thank you for your understanding

---

Guest (Aug 29, 2025, 4:48 AM):
Hi Katie, Just reaching out saying that the Check-In went swell, and the place is beautiful!! We just wanted to let you know after getting settled from our long day that a few lights didn’t work, a fan in the En-Suite Master Bedroom doesn’t work as well. Also, (could be from the rain that we got today) but the white lights that hang over the pool did fall, we did take them out, but now they are just laying on the ground. We did get the A/C to work in the main living space, but in the smaller rooms it isn’t, is there something we need to do for that?

---

Host (Aug 29, 2025, 5:30 AM):
Hi Skylar, good evening! Thanks for reaching out! I’m so glad to hear that your check-in went well and that you’re enjoying the beauty of the place. I appreciate you letting me know about the lights and the fan in the En-Suite Master Bedroom. I’m really sorry for the inconvenience. Regarding the pool lights, it sounds like they might have been affected by the rain. It’s best to leave those to the professionals, and I’ll have maintenance handle that as well. Is this affecting your stay or did you just want to let us know? Please let me know so I can escalate it to our maintenance team if needed. ☺️ As for the AC, we only have the mini split system in the living room, so the smaller rooms won’t have air conditioning. If you’re having trouble with the mini split, please check to make sure it’s plugged in and try using the remote to adjust the settings. Thank you for your patience and cooperation! If you need anything else, just let me know.

---

Host (Aug 29, 2025, 9:04 PM):
Good afternoon, Skylar! I hope you're having a lovely day. Please let me know how everything is going, and if you need anything else, don’t hesitate to reach out. Thank you for your understanding!

---

Guest (Sep 1, 2025, 6:11 AM):
If we were to do late check out? What would be the time it would be at?

---

Host (Sep 1, 2025, 3:03 PM):
Good morning Skylar! Thanks for reaching out about a late check-out. However, I want to let you know that it’s not possible, especially since we have same-day turnovers, which means our cleaning team needs the full window to prepare for the next guest. For now, I recommend planning on the standard check-out time of 10:00 AM. Thank you for your understanding, and let me know if you have any other questions!

---

Host (Sep 3, 2025, 1:00 AM):
Good evening Skylar, We hope you enjoyed your trip to Palomania - 4bedroom, games, and pool and felt right at home! You are checking out on: Sep 3, 2025 at 10:00 AM ★ CHECKOUT REMINDERS ★ To help us prepare for our next guests, we kindly ask that you: ✔ Wash any used dishes ✔ Take out any trash ✔ Lock up and return the key to the lockbox (If needed) Don't worry about the rest - we'll take care of everything else! Though if you have extra time and would like to tidy up, we certainly appreciate it. A few important notes: ✔ If you need a late check-out, we can arrange this for $100 with prior approval. **Please message prior to the day of Check-Out ✔ Please ensure you have all your personal belongings ✔ Missing keys will incur a $150 replacement fee ✔ Just send us a quick message when you depart Thank you for choosing to stay with us. We hope you'll think of us again for your future travels. Have a safe journey home! Best wishes, Katie and the OODA Hosting Team ***

---

Host (Sep 3, 2025, 3:00 PM):
Hi Skylar! I hope you're doing well! We have a small favor to ask that will only take about 60 seconds. If you could kindly fill out this quick survey, we’d love to offer you $150 off your next stay at ANY of our properties as a thank you! Your feedback is invaluable to us and helps us improve our services. The survey must be completed within 24 hours of your checkout Simply copy the link below to ensure it's tied to your reservation, which makes sure you get the discount on your future stay. https://l.oodahost.ai/post-survey?c=HM8M2QQA3W ***

custom_fields.name: Total Operating Expenses Funded By Manager

ai.prompt:
Your role is to look at the "Task Name" and/or "Task Description" and then assign the "deadline_type" for all Task or Subtask that are created. Make sure to follow these rules when assigning the "deadline_type" :

Hard: Homeowner requests, issues affecting current guest stays
Must Not Miss: High impact/urgency homeowner requests, high impact issues during guest stays
Soft: Everything else (by default)

Key Decision Points:

Is this a homeowner request? →set to "Hard"
Does it affect a current guest stay? → set to "Hard"
Is it high impact/urgency? → set to "Must Not Miss"
Is it an on-site issue during guest stay? → set to "Hard"

options.name: 5 Stars, but to be honest, we experienced some friction we would like to bring up
4 Stars, I am upset with my stay, there was significant friction and your team did not handle it properly
3 Stars, I am very upset, there were major problems with your property or team
2 Stars, I am surprised you are in business
1 Star, This was the worst stay I have ever experienced
